definition: to wait/to inquire after/to watch/season/climate/(old) period of five days

sentences.english: Dad and I are going to treat you like a queen today.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸和我，今天要像侍候女王般地侍候您。

sentences.english: Dad and I are going to treat you like a queen today.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸和我，今天要像侍候女王般地侍候您。

sentences.english: She likes to be served with servants surrounded.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢让仆人前呼后拥地侍候她。

sentences.english: Many families still serve breakfast in bed, the mother of practice.
sentences.chinese: 不少家庭还有侍候母亲在床上吃早饭的惯例。

sentences.english: She enjoys staying with many servants.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢让仆人前呼后拥地侍候她。

sentences.english: I ministered to him in his last hours.
sentences.chinese: 他临终时我在旁边侍候。

sentences.english: I love to serve you, Jack.
A castrated man employed as a harem attendant or as a functionary in certain Asian courts.
sentences.chinese: 宦官，太监某些亚洲宫廷内，在内宫侍候。

sentences.english: The waiter is serving another customer.
sentences.chinese: 侍应正侍候另一位客人。

sentences.english: She enjoy that her servants be around her.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢让仆人前呼后拥地侍候她。

sentences.english: She loves to have servants dance attendance (up) on her.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢仆人前呼后拥地侍候她。

sentences.english: Mr. Johnson was a difficult person to wait on.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊先生是一个很难侍候的人。

sentences.english: I ministered to her in her last hours.

definition: to attend to/to care for (patients etc)/to look after/to wait upon/to serve/also written 伏侍, see also 服事[fu2 shi4]
to wait upon/to serve/to attend to sb's needs
to order (sb) around/to send on an errand/to order away
